description:
Calothrix rhizosoleniae SC01 is a species of cyanobacteria that was isolated from the diatom Rhizosolenia setigera. It belongs to the genus Calothrix, which is a group of filamentous, nitrogen-fixing cyanobacteria.

Calothrix rhizosoleniae SC01 is a unicellular, filamentous cyanobacterium that exhibits a characteristic tapering of the filaments, with a basal heterocyst (a specialized cell that can fix atmospheric nitrogen). The cells within the filaments are typically cylindrical in shape and can exhibit a sheath, which is a protective layer surrounding the filament.

This species is known to form symbiotic relationships with certain diatoms, such as Rhizosolenia setigera, where the cyanobacterium provides fixed nitrogen to the diatom in exchange for organic carbon compounds produced by the diatom through photosynthesis. This mutualistic relationship is believed to be ecologically important in marine environments.

Calothrix rhizosoleniae SC01 has been studied for its potential applications in biofuel production and nutrient cycling in aquatic ecosystems due to its nitrogen-fixing capabilities and its ability to form symbiotic associations with other organisms.
